statuses.tip: Provider offers a quote to of their services and prices to be reviewed by the customer
Customer sends a direct inquiry for services to be reviewed by all available providers
Order requires the customer to provide a card or another payment option for reserving funds and authorise it for use on QLOGA
Please wait, authorisation request is being deleted.
Please wait, the customer has provided the payment information for funding the order and the card is being processed by the banks
Customer has rejected the provider’s quote
Provider has declined the customer’s direct inquiry
The customer and provider have accepted the order, funds are reserved and will be released after the services are provided, and the customer has approved them
Provider has arrived at customer’s address
Provider is close to the customer’s address, but their exact location is unavailable
Provider fully completed all services requested by the customer, fulfilling the order
Provider has arrived at the address for a service delivery visits but is unable to send GPS coordinates
Provider arrived at the address for one of the service delivery visits ordered by the customer
Provider has completed their service delivery visit
Customer or provider have cancelled the service delivery visit
Customer is not satisfied with at least one of the ordered services provided. The provider may not be paid for this visit.
Payment capture from the customer card is being process by the banks
Payment for the visit has been authorised by customer’s bank and is being processed
The customer is satisfied with the service(s) provided for at least one of the ordered services for this visit. QLOGA has begun the payment process.
Provider request to pay visit callout charge is being verified.
Please wait. Payment capture from the customer card is being process by the banks
The customers credit card issuer’s bank have declined the authorisation attempt
Customer credit card issuer bank have refused payment capture.
The customer is satisfied with the service(s) provided for at least one of the ordered services. Payment processing has started.
Order is paid, customer’s bank has initiated  the transfer of payment to QLOGA’s account.
The customer has been reviewed by the provider
Provided services have  been reviewed by the customer.
Order is closed
Order is canceled by either party.
Order is canceled by the customer. Provider may be able to dispute it or request callout charge.
Customer is unhappy with the provided services and unwilling to pay.
Either party, customer or provider, is unhappy with the counterparty and would like to involve QLOGA’s dispute resolution team.
Provider request to pay callout charge is being verified.

prv_actions.tip: Send your quote and notify customer.
Withdraw and delete your quote.
Decline customer’s direct inquiry for your services.
Inquiry is declined automatically due to no response from the provider.
Update your quote or suggest an update of a customer's direct inquiry for your services.
Accept the customer’s direct inquiry and enter into the digital contract.
Notify the customer that you have arrived at their address.
Notify customer that you have arrived, but you are unable to share your location.
Job complete, services have been delivered.
Customer is not home when you arrived on site for a visit
Visit complete, services have been delivered.
Notify the customer that you have arrived, but are unable to share your location.
Cancel a single visit, this will only cancel the whole order if there  is only one visit in the order.
Notify the customer that you have arrived at the address.
Submit a request for the visit callout charge to QLOGA support team.
Leave private or public feedback regarding your customer .
Leave no feedback regarding your customer.
Reschedule the order and move it back into Negotiations as a quote, so it can be updated.
Submit a request for callout charge to QLOGA support team.
Customer is not home when you arrived on site.
Start the dispute resolution process with QLOGA’s help.
Quote/Inquiry early cancellation. This cancellation is not recorded in the provider profile.
When you cancel, your number of cancelled orders in the last 3 months is visible to all potential customers .

cst_actions.tip: Send a direct inquiry for the provider’s service(s).
Withdraw and delete your direct inquiry for the provider’s service(s).
Update your direct inquiry or suggest an update on the provider’s quote.
Decline provider’s quote.
Quote is declined automatically due to no response from the customer.
Accept provider’s quote and enter into the digital contract.
Confirm provider’s arrival at your address.
Confirm you are satisfied with the work and happy to pay using the funds reserved earlier.
Confirm the provider has arrived at the customer’s address.
If the provider has not arrived within 15 mins of the visit agreed time, you may cancel the visit.
Approve the visit and initiate funds transfer from the customer’s credit card issuer bank.

Cancelling this visit will not cancel the whole order unless there is only one visit in the order. Your total number of cancelled orders within the last 3 months is visible to all potential customers.
Declare yourself unsatisfied with the single service delivery visit, visit may not be paid.
Your payment card (new or saved) will have the funds for the order reserved, no money will be withdrawn at this stage.
Leave private or public feedback regarding the provider/service and ratings.
Leave no feedback regarding the provider/service..
Reschedule the order and move it back into Negotiations as an inquiry, so it can be updated.
Quote/Inquiry early cancellation
If the order is cancelled, outside of the free cancelation period, you may be liable to pay a callout charge.
Start a dispute resolution process with QLOGA’s help.
If the provider has not arrived within 15 mins of the agreed time, you may cancel the order.
If you are unsatisfied with the job, the provider needs to resolve the situation with you or raise a dispute.
